title: A single response
description: Follow this pattern to collect one logical piece of information at a time, allowing users to focus on specific questions.

frontMatter.title: A single response
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to collect one logical piece of information at a time, allowing users to focus on specific questions.
frontMatter.intro: Asking for one logical thing at a time allows users to focus on what you are asking from them. While a page may contain multiple form fields, the "one thing" refers to the information being gathered conceptually.

when_to_use.value: **Collecting related responses.** When collecting one or a few related responses from users.
**Reducing complexity.** When dividing long forms into logical sections.
**Focused information gathering.** When situations require clear, focused questions.

design_principles.value: **One thing per page.** This encompasses: one piece of information, one decision, or one question.
**Limit conditional reveals.** When using conditional reveals, limit to one per page.
**Make revealed questions clear.** Conditionally revealed questions should be self-explanatory.
**Create distinct error messages.** Each field should have its own error message.

when_not_to_use.value: **Multiple similar items.** When collecting the same data about multiple items, use the Multiple Responses pattern.
**Unknown quantity.** When gathering an unknown quantity of responses, use the Multiple Responses pattern.

examples.title: Single question page
examples.description: Page with one focused question and clear call to action.

examples.title: Related fields grouped
examples.description: Multiple fields that together represent one logical concept (e.g., full address).

how_to_build.intro: Design forms using the "one thing per page" principle.

steps.value: Brainstorm concepts using sticky notes to identify individual 'things'.
Assume each concept belongs on separate pages initially.
Conduct card sorting exercises with teams to group related items.
Research how concepts link in existing solutions.
Reorganize into related groupings where appropriate.
Map user flow and test with actual users.

frontMatter.code_usage:
The single response pattern reduces cognitive load, simplifies error handling, improves mobile experiences, and enhances screen reader compatibility.

**Production examples:**
- VA Form 21-0972 (Alternate Signer)
- VA Form 21-10210 (Lay/Witness Statement)
- VA Form 20-0995 (Supplemental Claim)
- VA Form 20-10206 (FOIA/Privacy Act Request)

content_considerations.value: Focus each page on one logical concept, even if it contains multiple form fields.
Use clear, concise questions that don't require additional context.
Provide helpful hint text only when necessary.

accessibility.value: The W3C notes that keeping content to a small number of important points reduces clutter and aids understanding.
This benefits users with cognitive disabilities who may struggle with focus and information retention.
Ensure keyboard accessibility for conditionally revealed fields.
Provide clear focus management when revealing additional fields.
